news_header: Two studies are ongoing in a doctoral dissertation process at the University of Lapland, which has faced rejection and appeals regarding its scientific validity.
news_text: The doctoral dissertation process at the University of Lapland is currently under scrutiny, with two studies still in progress. The Board of Appeal will determine the acceptance or rejection of the dissertation, which was previously rejected by the Faculty of Arts for not meeting scientific criteria. Lauri Törhönen, a Finnish film director, has been involved in this case, which has gained media attention. The university is investigating allegations of violations of Good Scientific Language, and the final decision by the Board of Appeal is pending.
